page.title: 14Fund Raising, Thurleigh
page.content: The Church was in need of a new roof for the nave and even with a 60% grant from the Department of the Environment, Â£10,000 had to be found by the village people. Fund raising begun - cyder and baked potato, cheese and wine parties and Harvest Supper, an auction and all the usual fund raising events. The difference being that they were all held in the nave of the Church. In Mediaeval times the nave was always used for fairs, sales, markets and for keeping the animals in during the winter. It has only been since Elizabeth 1 that the church building has been used solely for worship. St. Peters is now used in the same way - for any events as long as they are not 'immoral'.
